references.reason: This paper introduced denoising diffusion probabilistic models (DDPMs), a foundational work in diffusion models which are heavily related to the current paper's topic of flow-based models.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper significantly advanced diffusion models, enabling high-resolution image generation, which is contextually relevant due to the paper's goal of accelerating flow-based models to achieve real-time performance.
This paper introduced neural ordinary differential equations (NODEs), a technique used in flow-based models, which are central to the work presented, making it a highly relevant foundational paper.
This work introduced the flow matching technique, a key concept for training flow-based models, which is directly relevant to the methods and results presented in the paper.

This paper introduced classifier-free guidance, a crucial technique for improving the quality and controllability of generated images in diffusion models.  The method's applicability extends to flow-based models, making it highly relevant.
